            TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CREDIT FOR FINANCIAL,TF027084-PHRD-ECONOMIC MANAGEMENT PROJECT,TF025497-PHRD-RURAL FINANCIAL MARKET
            DEV. PROJECT,TF022840-GERMAN JPO -- MS. MICHAELA WEBER,TF040703-LATIN AMERICA:FINANCIAL
            MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC SECTOR MODERNIZATION,TF039697-NICARAGUA - INSTITUTIONAL
            DEVELOPMENT CREDIT,TF036947-NICARAGUA - ECONOMIC MANAGEMENT TA,TF036946-NICARAGUA - ECONOMIC MANAGEMENT TA,TF029370-PHRD -PUBLIC POLICY &
            ADMINISTRATIVE REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Management Technical
            Assistance Project in Nicaragua, aims at expanding public
            sector modernization, improving the government's
            economic planning, policy formulation, and execution
            capacity. This will further strengthen governance, hence
            improve business confidence, private sector growth, and
            poverty alleviation. The project components include: 1) the
            extension of the Integrated Financial Management Reform
            (SIGFA), to support the deepening of reforms in financial
            management sub-systems. Financial management reforms will be
            extended to central government ministries, and entities,
            through training, capacity building, and information
            technology. In line with SIGFA, financial management systems
            will be available for municipal development, and, public
            awareness promotion will be supported; 2) deepening of civil
            service reform to support the recent Civil Service and
            Administrative Career Law - legislation approval is
            conditional to disbursement. Capacity building will be
            reinforced, through technical assistance and training; 3)
            economic management strengthening, through macroeconomic
            policy, public investment, and improved social programs, and
            fiscal policy formulation. Internal operations/services to
            the public, will be reinforced, to impact economic and
            investment activities; and, 4) public sector reforms, to
            implement the Reorganization Law, strengthen public sector
            integrity, and coordinate the state reform implementation.
